alert.note: Alert for Grays Harbor; Thurston (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 05 at 11:46AM PST until December 08 at 9:50AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Seattle WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington... Nooksack River At Ferndale affecting Whatcom County. Chehalis River Above Grand Mound affecting Grays Harbor and Thurston Counties. .Heavy rainfall has ended in the north Cascades but continues for southwest Washington where another 1-2 inches are expected. The flood waves from the heavy rain since yesterday will drive the lower Nooksack and mid Chehalis River above flood stage. For the North West Region...including Saxon Bridge, North Cedarville, Ferndale, Burlington, Concrete, Mt. Vernon, Arlington, Jordan Rd. Bridge, Arlington...Major flooding is forecast. For the Chehalis River Basin Region...including Bucoda, Centralia, Chehalis, Doty, Centralia, Grand Mound, Porter...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chehalis River above Grand Mound. * WHEN...From this evening to late Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 142.5 feet, the Chehalis River in Thurston County will flood several roads in Independence Valley with swiftly moving water including SR-12 and James, Independence, Moon and Anderson Roads. Flood waters will cut off access to and from Chehalis Reservation and inundate nearby farm lands. Some residential structures may be threatened. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM PST Tuesday the stage was 137.5 feet. - Flood stage is 141.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 142.7 feet late tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday morning. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 800 PM PST.
